meanings.definition: The office or jurisdiction of an admiral.
meanings.sent1: In the admiralties, the admiral makes important decisions for the navy.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to reach the admiralties and become an admiral one day.
meanings.sent3: The admiralties were abuzz with excitement as the new admiral took charge.
meanings.sent4: His leadership in the admiralties guided the navy through turbulent waters.
meanings.sent5: The admiralties were a place of authority and responsibility.

meanings.definition: The rank or office of an admiral.
meanings.sent1: The admiralties bestowed upon him the highest rank in the navy.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to achieve the admiralties and earn the title of admiral.
meanings.sent3: At the ceremony, he proudly accepted the admiralties and became an admiral.
meanings.sent4: His dedication led him to the admiralties, where he excelled as an admiral.
meanings.sent5: The admiralties symbolized his journey to becoming an admiral.

meanings.definition: The officials or the department of state having charge of naval affairs, as in Great Britain.
meanings.sent1: The admiralties in Great Britain oversee all naval operations.
meanings.sent2: She was appointed to a high position within the admiralties of Great Britain.
meanings.sent3: The admiralties of Great Britain work tirelessly to ensure naval readiness.
meanings.sent4: His career goal was to lead the admiralties of Great Britain.
meanings.sent5: The admiralties of Great Britain play a crucial role in national defense.
